algorithm_technique: Iterate through the linked list, using a set for O(1) lookup of values in nums.
Count components by checking transitions from a value not in nums to a value in nums.
problem_summary_simple: Count connected components in a linked list based on a given subset of values.
problem_summary_technical: Traverse linked list, identify components using a set of target values, counting transitions.
key_insights: Using a set for the `nums` array allows for efficient O(1) average time lookups.
A component starts when a node's value is in `nums` and the previous node's value was not.
A dummy node can simplify edge case handling for the head of the list.
